messages.content: You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `routes/api.php`, I found that `App\\Http\\Controllers\\Api\\V1\\PostLikeController@destroy` is imported to process HTTP requests to the path `/v1/posts/{post}/likes`. I'll provide you with the contents of file `routes/api.php`, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to find files that contain the implementation of `App\\Http\\Controllers\\Api\\V1\\PostLikeController@destroy`. You must focus on the implementation itself and ignore unit tests or functional tests. You need to output a list of paths to the files that contain the handler implementations, ensuring that each path is relative to the project's directory. You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
Paths:
- app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/PostLikeController.php
- app/Http/Controllers/PostLikeController.php (similarly named controller, not the one referenced by routes/api.php)

Explanation:
- I searched the repository for PostLikeController class definitions and found two controller files.
- The route in routes/api.php references App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1\PostLikeController@destroy. The implementation for that class/method is in app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/PostLikeController.php. Its destroy(Post $post) method simply calls and returns $post->dislike().
- There is a second, non-API controller at app/Http/Controllers/PostLikeController.php which also defines a destroy(Post $post) method, but it returns Turbo Stream responses for the web UI. This file is not the controller imported by routes/api.php, so it is not the handler used for the /v1/posts/{post}/likes DELETE route.
